result.execSummary:
The defendant Firass A Assad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer AMENDED FROM ESCAPE [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of extended supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Absolute sobriety is required. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Paternity is to be established for the child. Must comply with any and all family court orders relative to paternity of child. No violent contact with victim. Firearm warning given. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on extended supervision.

Defendant Firass A Assad in court with attorney Patrick K Cafferty.  Defendant Firass A Assad in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
The State has spoken with several members of DOC and defendant was revoked on 4/29. The order and warrant for revocation will be resent today. They expect to send Mr. Assad to an institution by 5/29.
The State recommends, on Ct 1-2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES, consecutive and on Cts 4 & 5 - 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, yr ES, conc with each other.
Victim addresses the Court. Defense is asking for 90 days RCJ conc to time currently being served on Ct 1 and on Cts 4 & 5-concurrent to Ct 1 and to revocation. Deft addresses the Court.

BTC: Ct 1-90 days RCJ/CFTS, conc to time currently being served
         Ct 4-Total sentence is 2 ys WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC,1 yrs ES, conc to resisting
         Ct 5-Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yrs ES, consec to revocation and Ct 1

Preliminary hearing on January 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
